channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fly tipping, 29th September
item.description:
Recently there is an issue with fly tipping in the garage area of Braeside Crescent. As nothing has been done lately, there is more rubbish being dumped on a regular basis. This area is supposed to be a gated area but it appears that nobody has the correct key to open and shut this gate.If the fly tipping is either stopped or cleared up, this will stop residents that have garages or whose rear entrances being able to have access and the fly tipping will no doubt continue. As a resident in this area and paying for a garage I would like this issue being given appropriate acton before it become a health and safety issue
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Braeside Crescent, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Branches touching phone lines, 29th September
item.description:
Hi. I live at 61 rosebery avenue and there is a tree outside 63 rosebery that’s overgrowing and its branches are not just over hanging onto phone lines there is one big branch where the phone line is now slighty bending around the branch and touching the branch and you can see where it’s rubbing up and down on the branch now. There was a. Tree being cut back down the down today but they didn’t attend to that tree

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Rosebery Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 57 Trehurst Street, overflowing bins, 29th September
item.description:
57 Trehurst Street often has overflowing bins. The property is a 6 bedroom HMO and produces a lot of waste. Excess rubbish bags are frequently left out and attract vermin and foxes, with rubbish spilling out onto the street

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Trehurst Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sewage leak, 29th September
item.description:
For several weeks sewage water fronm drains at 23 Wilberforce Rd has been leaking and now floods into the garden at 25 Wilberforce Rd. I noticed it strongly on 28 Sept as the smell became extreme. It smells of toilet/kitchen waste and is a health hazard.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilberforce Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins - Marvels Lane SE12 9PE, 29th September
item.description:
